snippet: The 19th-century brownstone in New Jersey and the modernist glass-and-concrete house in Florida share the same sensibility: subtly skewed.
abstract: Isabelle and Jerome Peribere split their time between modernist 6,000-square-foot home in Miami on Biscayne Bay and their gut-renovated 19th-century brownstone overlooking a quiet garden in Hoboken, NJ; both homes were first design projects of Ms Peribere's interior design firm.
lead_paragraph: The 19th-century brownstone in New Jersey and the modernist glass-and-concrete house in Florida share the same sensibility: subtly skewed.

headline.kicker: On Location: Miami and Hoboken, N.J.
